meanings.definition: Having a single pair of leaflets.
meanings.sent1: The unijugate plant had only one pair of leaflets on each stem.
meanings.sent2: The botanist identified the unijugate leaves by their unique structure.
meanings.sent3: The unijugate plant thought it was special because it only needed one pair of leaflets.
meanings.sent4: Her unijugate garden was like a symphony of green, with each leaflet playing its part.
meanings.sent5: The unijugate leaves stood out in the forest, making it easy to spot the rare plant.

meanings.sent1: The unijugate leaf was small but perfectly formed.
meanings.sent2: The tree had unijugate leaves that shimmered in the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The unijugate leaf felt lonely being the only one on the branch.
meanings.sent4: Her unijugate notebook held all her thoughts in one neat package.
meanings.sent5: The unijugate leaf danced in the breeze, showing off its simplicity and beauty.
